page.title: 04HALE AND WOODGREEN CHURCHES
page.content: ST.MARYS CHURCH AT HALE LIES BEHIND HALE HOUSE AND CAN ONLY BE REACHED BY FOOTPATH OR BY DRIVING THROUGH THE GROUNDS OF HALE HOUSE .IT IS ABOUT ONE MILE OUT OF THE VILLAGE. ON AVERAGE ABOUT 24 PEOPLE ATTEND THE CHURCH EACH SUNDAY AND ONCE A MONTH, AFTER MARTINS, COFFEE AND BISCUITS ARE SERVED TO THE PARISHIONERS IN THE NORTH WING OF HALE HOUSE. WOODGREEN WAS JOINED TO THE PARISH OF HALE IN 1927 AND THE CHURCH ROOM THERE WAS DEDICATED TO ST.BONIFACE IN 1949. SUNDAY SCHOOL FOR THE CHILDREN IS HELD HERE EACH WEEK. IN THE YEAR ENDING 1ST.JUNE,1985, THERE WERE 4 BAPTISMS, 3 MARRIAGES AND 13 BURIALS IN HALE AND WOODGREEN . WOODGREEN ALSO HAS AN ACTIVE METHO- DIST CHAPEL.
